ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Serious Everquest question, please help
ygData.msgSnippet: I envy all of you. What better way to spend a night with the family. AWESOME Rob ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Send
ygData.messageBody:
I envy all of you.
What better way to spend a night with the family.


AWESOME


Rob
--- Cerasmuerto Ahora <cerasmuerto@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks for sharing Su! I can tell you this,
> though. It is admirable that your mother plays the
> game. Most parents wont play the game and consider
> it evil. I am one of the few lucky parents that
> like to play the game with my family. LOL in fact
> we have a family friday night. My family is big
> enough that we can have two groups. Yet we enjoy
> it!
> So, basically what I am saying is Kudos to your mom
> for playing and like you said at least trying. But
> I dont think fat ass was necessary LOL. Yet it did
> provide a funny mental picture.
> Cerasmuerto Ahora
> Your Rogue in Hiding
> Su <suceress@...> wrote: Ick. That sucks.
> Yeah, it's always wise to choose your groups
> carefully. If you notice a bad
> pattern-- like the main puller pulling nonstop and
> not giving you time to
> med, make sure you tell them to stop pulling. If
> they don't listen, that's
> when you leave.
> I had trouble in group last night bc after my bro
> (the main tank) logged
> off, our new tank went and pulled when I said I was
> AFK and not to pull. I
> was the main healer. When I came back my mother was
> sitting in my chair
> shrieking about how she couldn't heal people. She
> blocked my keyboard with
> her hands and I couldnt' see the screen. Turned out
> I was still sitting. I
> managed to reach over and stand up but she swatted
> my hands away and started
> casting heal-- on the mobs. Wasted most of my mana.
> I finally got her to
> move her fat ass out of my chair and got to my
> keyboard but it was too late.
> I managed to get off a couple heals on the druid but
> then went oom and
> couldn't save myself. I should have gated but I
> didn't want to ditch the
> others. I didn't realize they said it was ok to
> zone. Big mistake. I ended
> up dead. Fortunately they found a high lvl cleric to
> rez me and I got back
> more xp than I'd remembered having.
> Don't mind me. Just felt like sharing. I was mad at
> my mom at first but she
> was only trying to help. It's kinda funny in
> retrospect.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> Appreciate the response but I was hunting with
> others, no one I know
> personally, and when I died I figured to just go
> back, but when I got back
> my corspe was gone. I had 2 orc centurions on me
> and none of them helped
> at that point,
>
> So, I learnt a good lesson, don't go with others if
> you can't handle the
> stuff yourself.
>
> Thanks
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: mlockridge01
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Sunday, January 06, 2002 11:49 AM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Re: Serious Everquest
> question, please help
>
>
> If you die at levels below 5 you should resurrect
> with five days of
> food and water. If your corpse had nothing on it,
> it may have
> disappeared, but your own anwswer is most likely.
> You misplaced your
> corpse. Dying at levels below five is set to be
> low-penalty (you lose
> very little and get food and water when you come
> back) to make the
> early learning a bit easier.
>
> There are tools to find corpses, sold by
> merchants. However, it is
> best to learn to die with finding your corpse in
> mind. Try to look
> around at landmarks when death is clearly coming.
> Try to be near some
> object you can find easily when you come back. And
> unless you don't
> mind having to do this often, learn to fight in
> such a way as to
> seldom die. Some gamers like to take the risks
> leading to frequent
> deaths, but I prefer to hunt with care and die
> seldom. Seems more in
> the spirit of the game to me.
>
> Good hunting to you.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
> If --- In EverQuest@y..., "Minigamer"
> <rlebeau65@y...> wrote:
> > Hi all,
> >
> > Forgive my ignorance but I am a newbie had a 4th
> level Druid in the
> city of Elves and while out at the Orc Camp, with
> others, I got
> killed by an Orc Centurian and when I returned to
> get my corpse,
> nothing was there. It was not more than 4 minutes
> when I returned.
> >
> > Question: Is it possible for someone to Steal or
> Loot my corpse?
> The book says no but I beg to differ.
> > Is it possible that I had two corpses out there?
> Meaning, When I
> went back with a dead body I died again? Which
> meant I found the
> wrong corpse?
> >
> > And to add one last question, "what do I do now?
> seeing as I have
> no food, no money, no nothing?" Do I beg or do I
> start another char?
> > This game is totally fun but with the fact of
> trying to learn which
> way to go all the time and dying, it is starting
> to get to me,
> > I don't want to give up just yet and I turned to
> this board since
> the Chat from the game options was USELESS.
> >
> > Please help and Thanks in advance
> >
> > Rob
>
>
